comments:
I get the following exception when starting the new M5. It looks like the same  
problem reported in #44871 and #44735 but it happens on Win2k instead 0f Linux. 
I have tried the -Dorg.eclipse.core.runtime.ignoreLockFile as suggested by 
comment 3 of #44735 but I got the same result. Please note the a 1 byte(00) .
lock file is created in the .metadata folder of my workspace.

!SESSION ----------------------------------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Nov 23, 2003 11:48:02.640
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.
startup(InternalBootLoader.java:1040)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.
run(InternalBootLoader.java:838)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:461)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:299)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:767)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:601)
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.
activateDefaultPlugins(InternalPlatform.java:142)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.
loaderStartup(InternalPlatform.java:688)
	... 14 more

Although this is a startup problem, it is not related to the metadata area lock
file. It seems that your Eclipse install is in a invalid state.

Did you install M5 on an empty location or you overrode an existing install?

Do you run with only the unmodified built-in plug-ins, or you have other
plug-ins in your configuration?

It looks like a NPE is happening during org.eclipse.core.runtime activation. But
the line numbers in the stack trace do not match with the ones in Eclipse M5.

I overrode an existing install (2.1.2) as I've always done for previous 
upgrades. After reading your reply, I wiped out my eclipse folder and 
reinstalled M5. 
Now everything seems to be fine although I now need to reinstall Lunar Eclipse's 
Editor-enhancements plug-in. In my case, it's only one plug-in to reinstall but 
what about people having several external plug-ins? Shouldn't the override 
method work?

Thanks

No, overriding an existing install of Eclipse is not the way to upgrade. The
upgrade procedure is described at:

http://help.eclipse.org/help21/topic/org.eclipse.platform.doc.user/tasks/tasks-2.htm

The same topic describes what to do regarding third party plug-ins.
